title: What is the ping in Detroit for NA? Are there plans of an East Coast server? Thanks in advance!
body:
Hi all

Michigan just passed Cannabis legalization -- was already interested in moving to Detroit as it is artist-central now am all more excited.

Am interested to know the avg. ms or ping of players there and also if anyone knows this what are the most affordable places hooked up to Google Fiber in the city??

Love and peace

-Traumatization

Edit: Currently living in Durham NC getting 38 ms on AT&T U-verse so would expect something like 19 without Google Fiber but would be all too excited to hear of 8-11 ms

replies.body: As an artistical person with an avid music background yes!

> [{quoted}](name=Traumatization,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gq7fJ2HN,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-11-08T02:10:50.744+0000)
>
> As an artistical person with an avid music background yes!

Making art in Detroit? You'll have an ample supply of paint, but...

{{champion:202}} ["This would be easier if blood came in more colors."](https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/8/89/Jhin.move44.ogg)

######P.S.: It's "artistic."
do yourself a favor and move just a lil further north to canada where you can easily go to detriot if you want
Would it be as close to Chicago? I would even move to Chicago. The primary goal is lowest ms/ping possible.

idk look at a map. but i wouldnt want to live in detriot it is one of the most ran down, poverty stricken , highest crime rate places in the US. Chicago has issues too. hence why  i said move just further north to canada

Have yew heard of the artist-wave there? Many artists move there for cheap housing (Perhaps because of what yew mentioned?)
Plus I can help

I get 78 ping in Alaska. I haven't noticed a difference from that jump. You're only going to notice a slight difference if you're a pro player.

Before Riot moved the servers from Seattle to Chicago, I got 40 ping.

You shouldn't notice a huge difference as long as you're playing on a high speed connection. Distance only matters so much. Your connection type and the internet package you have is what really matters.

Please consult https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/2uTrAyy8-na-server-roadmap-update-chicago-server-move-complete
and the roadmap for how distance matters indeed.

I don't need to consult that page because I read it in 2015 when the server move happened my dude.

I think you'll be able to gentrify Detroit and play League just fine as long as you have high speed internet and use a cable instead of wifi.

Will maybe be on SSDI that is Disability Insurance - so really the only thing I might gentrify is someone further from Chicago getting into the server before me. Maybe a wealthy Caucasian for example.

well 1st off the server for NA is in chicago there is no east/west coast server. 

2ndly ping can be effected by many things not just riots servers 

3rd im 1400 miles from the server in chicago and play on wifi and i have steady 42 ping with no lag issues
I would also state - 42ping is a lag issue.

its not a lag issue. a lag issue is HIGH PING or unstable ping. 

i use to have 300 ping every game a few years ago.
I am 783 driving miles away from Chicago and get 38. I think distance is a factor as the page announcing the new server states 8ms at Chicago and increasing amounts as it goes East.
